alert.note: Alert for East Slopes Sangre de Cristo Mountains; Southern Sangre de Cristo Mountains (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: High Wind Warning issued October 22 at 10:48PM MDT until October 23 at 7:00PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...WIND ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM MDT SUNDAY... ...HIGH WIND WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 6 AM TO 7 PM MDT SUNDAY... * WHAT...For the High Wind Warning, southwest winds 25 to 35 mph with gusts up to 55 mph expected. For the Wind Advisory, southwest winds 25 to 35 mph with gusts up to 45 mph. * WHERE...East Slopes Sangre de Cristo Mountains and Southern Sangre de Cristo Mountains. * WHEN...For the High Wind Warning, from 6 AM to 7 PM MDT Sunday. For the Wind Advisory, until 6 AM MDT Sunday. * IMPACTS...Damaging winds will blow down trees and power lines. Widespread power outages are expected. Travel will be difficult, especially for high profile vehicles. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Large trees that were severely burned during the Hermits Peak-Calf Canyon fire will be especially susceptible to being blown down. Periods of snow during the day Sunday will likely lead to areas of reduced visibility in blowing snow.
info.instruction: Take action to secure trash cans, lawn furniture, and other loose or lightweight outdoor objects. Extremely hazardous driving conditions can be expected, especially for motorists in high profile vehicles who should consider delaying travel.

area.areaDesc: East Slopes Sangre de Cristo Mountains; Southern Sangre de Cristo Mountains
